docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome to GRAVITY by Sana Ijlal Shahrukh

Engineering Intelligent Attraction

Gravity builds intelligent systems by engineering intelligent attraction between data, models, and decisions.

docs.title: About Me
docs.text: I am a biomedical engineer with 15+ years of experience spanning medical devices, signal processing, and higher education. My current focus is on AI and data-driven systems that translate complex biomedical data into actionable clinical insights. I build solutions at the intersection of biomedical instrumentation, computational modeling, and intelligent analytics, informed by real-world healthcare constraints. With a strong foundation in electronics and biosignals, I aim to design scalable, patient-centered technologies powered by modern data science.

docs.title: Education
docs.text:
• Master of Science (Analytics) January 2026-Present — Georgia Institute of Technology. Atlanta, GA, USA.

  • Master of Engineering (Electronics Engineering) — NED University of Engineering & Technology. Karachi, Pakistan.

  • Bachelor of Science (Biomedical Engineering) — Sir Syed University of Engineering & Technology. Karachi, Pakistan.

docs.title: About Gravity
docs.text:
Gravity is a personal AI and data science brand built around a simple idea: intelligence creates attraction.

At its core, Gravity focuses on designing intelligent systems that naturally pull insights, decisions, and impact out of data.

At its core, Gravity focuses on designing intelligent systems that naturally pull insights, decisions, and impact out of data. By combining engineering discipline, analytical thinking, and modern AI techniques, Gravity transforms complex information into systems that are precise, scalable, and meaningful.

Gravity represents the invisible force behind intelligent solutions — where data converges, models evolve, and ideas gain momentum.

Gravity — Engineering Intelligent Attraction.

docs.title: 🔖 Quick Info
docs.text:
• Name: Sana Ijlal Shahrukh
  • Location: Leesburg, VA, USA
  • Email: sanahyder@gmail.com

docs.title: ✨ Professional Summary
docs.text: Biomedical engineer with 15+ years of experience in medical devices, biomedical instrumentation, and academic research. Currently transitioning into data science and analytics, with hands-on experience in Python, signal processing, and computational modeling. Focused on transforming clinical, imaging, and sensor data into actionable insights for patient-centered healthcare and intelligent medical systems.

docs.title: 🧰 Key Skills
docs.text:
• Domain Expertise Medical devices • Biomedical instrumentation • Physiology • Clinical research • Regulatory fundamentals (ISO 13485, FDA concepts)

  • Data Science & Analytics Exploratory data analysis • Feature engineering • Statistical modeling • Time-series analysis • Model validation

  • Programming & Technical Computing Python • MATLAB • C / C++ • Arduino • Microprocessor/Microcontroller programming • R

  • Tools & Platforms Jupyter • Git • LabVIEW • CAD tools • Microsoft Excel (data analysis) • PowerPoint

  • Imaging & Signal Processing Biomedical signal processing (ECG, respiratory signals) • Medical imaging systems • Sensor data analysis

  • Research & Professional Skills Experimental design • Technical writing • Teaching & mentoring • Cross-disciplinary collaboration

docs.title: 💼 Experience (select / template)
docs.text:
• Lecturer / Lab Engineer — Imam Abdulrahman Bin Faisal University (2016–2024) Designed and delivered biomedical engineering and electronics courses integrating signal processing and computational analysis Developed laboratory experiments using MATLAB, LabVIEW, and sensor-based data acquisition systems Supervised student research projects in medical devices and biosignal analytics

  • Assistant Professor — Sir Syed University of Engineering & Technology (2007–2014) Designed and delivered courses in biomedical instrumentation and signal processing. Developed laboratory experimental studies involving sensor systems, data acquisition, and analysis pipelines. Collaborated with clinicians on translational medical engineering projects

  • Service Engineer — Biotech Pakistan Pvt. Ltd. (2005–2007) Maintained and calibrated critical care medical equipment, ensuring safety and performance compliance Supported medical device procurement through technical evaluation and lifecycle planning Developed preventive maintenance documentation improving equipment reliability

docs.title: 📂 Selected Projects
docs.text:
• Respiratory Monitoring System

    • Designed and analyzed sensor-based respiratory diagnostics using physiological signal processing.
    • Tech: MATLAB, biomedical sensors, signal analysis

  • Digital Tele-Stethoscope

    • Implemented real-time acquisition and transmission of auscultation signals for remote diagnostics.
    • Tech: Embedded systems, signal processing

  • Cost-Effective PCR Thermocycler

    • Designed a low-cost thermocycler prototype integrating control systems and thermal profiling.
    • Tech: Electronics design, system modeling

docs.title: 🎓 Education
docs.text:
• Master of Science (Analytics) — Georgia Institute of Technology • In Progress

    • Focus on data analytics, statistical modeling, and computational methods for real-world applications.

  • Master of Engineering (Electronics Engineering) — NED University of Engineering & Technology (2009–2011)

    • Specialization in Micro-System Design, VLSI, analog/digital circuits, and system-level modeling.

  • Bachelor of Science (Biomedical Engineering) — Sir Syed University of Engineering & Technology (2002–2006)

    • Biomedical instrumentation, medical imaging, biosignal processing, and medical device design.

docs.title: Skills
docs.text: My skill set bridges biomedical engineering and data-driven intelligence. I work with biomedical signals, medical devices, and computational systems, applying AI and analytical methods to extract meaningful insights from complex data. My background in electronics and instrumentation enables me to design systems end-to-end—from sensing and acquisition to modeling and interpretation. I am experienced in research, technical writing, and building solutions that translate engineering innovation into real-world healthcare impact.

docs.title: Technical Skills
docs.text:
• Programming and Computing:(Beginner-Intermediate)
  • Python (data analysis, basic machine learning)
  • MATLAB (signal processing, modeling)
  • C++ (foundational knowledge)
  • R (introductory level)
  • LabVIEW (data acquisition & instrumentation)
  • Data Analysis & Visualization:(Beginner)
  • Pandas, NumPy,
  • Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly
  • Basic exploratory data analysis (EDA)
  • Machine Learning & AI:(Beginner)
  • Scikit-learn (basic models, preprocessing)
  • Introductory knowledge of TensorFlow & Keras
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts (supervised/unsupervised learning, model evaluation)
  • Familiarity with large language models (LLMs) at a conceptual levelScikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, LLMs
  • Biomedical Signal Processing:
  • ECG, EEG, EMG analysis
  • Signal filtering and basic feature extraction
  • Interpretation of physiological data
  • Medical Devices & Instrumentation:
  • Sensor interfacing,
  • Data acquisition systems,
  • Basics of embedded and instrumentation systems
  • Tools & Platforms:
  • Git and Github (version control basics)
  • Jupyter Notebooks
  • Introductory exposure to Cloud services (AWS, GCP)

docs.title: Soft Skills
